==German== ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|de|goh|zol}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*tullō||what is counted or told}}. Alternatively from {{der|de|ML.|toloneum}}, from {{der|de|la|telōnēum}}. ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|de|/tsɔl/}} * {{audio|de|De-Zoll.ogg|Audio}} ====Noun==== {{de-noun|m|Zolls|gen2=Zolles|Zölle}} # {{l|en|custom}} {{gloss|duty collected at the borders}} # {{l|en|customs}} {{gloss|authority collecting that duty}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|(e)s|pl=Zölle}} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|de|zollpflichtig}} ===Etymology 2=== ====Noun==== {{de-noun|n||Zoll}} # unit of length {{gloss|if used nowadays it equals an {{l|en|inch}}}} =====Declension===== {{de-decl-noun-n|s|}} [[Category:de:Units of measure]] ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|goh|lb}} {{m|goh|zol}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|Zoll}}, {{cog|en|toll}}, {{cog|nl|tol}}, {{cog|is|tollur}}, {{cog|sv|tull}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/tsol/}} ** {{rhymes|lb|ol}} ===Noun=== {{lb-noun|m|Zoll}} # [[custom]], [[duty]] # [[customs]]
